Plot model predictions vs observed outcomes

Plot model predictions vs observed outcomes

# S3 method for hcai_predicted_df
plot(x, outcomes = NULL, print = TRUE, ...)

Arguments

x

data frame as returned `predict.model_list`
outcomes

Vector of outcomes if not present in x
print

Logical, if TRUE (default) the plot is printed on the current graphics device. The plot is always (silently) returned.
...

Parameters to pass to plot_regression_predictions or plot_classification_predictions

Value

A ggplot object

Details

The following arguments can be provided to customize the plot: For regression: title, point_size, point_alpha, font_size. For classification: title, fill_colors, fill_alpha, curve_flex, font_size. For details on how to use them, see plot_regression_predictions or plot_classification_predictions.

Examples

models <- machine_learn(pima_diabetes[1:50, ], patient_id, outcome = plasma_glucose)
#> Training new data prep recipe
#> Variable(s) ignored in prep_data won't be used to tune models: patient_id
#> plasma_glucose looks numeric, so training regression algorithms.
#> Running cross validation for Random Forest
#> Running cross validation for k-Nearest Neighbors
predictions <- predict(models)
plot(predictions)
plot(predictions, title = "This model's predictions regress to the mean",
     point_size = 3, point_alpha = .7, font_size = 14)

Contents
